solution_line_template: She can buy {num_candy_bags} bags of candy because {total_money} / {candy_bag_cost} = <<{total_money}/{candy_bag_cost}={num_candy_bags}>>{num_candy_bags}
She can buy {num_chip_bags} bags of chips because {total_money} / {chips_bag_cost} = <<{total_money}/{chips_bag_cost}={num_chip_bags}>>{num_chip_bags}.
She gets {total_candy_ounces} ounces of candy because {num_candy_bags} x {candy_ounces_per_bag} = <<{num_candy_bags}*{candy_ounces_per_bag}={total_candy_ounces}>>{total_candy_ounces}
She gets {total_chip_ounces} ounces of chips because {num_chip_bags} x {chips_ounces_per_bag} = <<{num_chip_bags}*{chips_ounces_per_bag}={total_chip_ounces}>>{total_chip_ounces}
The gets {max_ounces} ounces in food because {total_chip_ounces} > {total_candy_ounces}
